sentences.en: A thousand thanks for your patronage.
Banks retain youngsters'loyalty and continued patronage in the future.
sentences.cn: 银行获得孩子们的信任,使他们在将来继续惠顾银行.

sentences.en: He has a great deal of patronage in his hands.
He knew that she was taking the patronage out of his hands.
sentences.cn: 他知道她是在他手里把授取的大权拿过去.

sentences.en: His patronage, entwined with the ordinary deference, was not plain to them.
sentences.cn: 由于还需要表现出通常的尊敬态度, 他那恩赐的态度对他们也就不很明显了.

sentences.en: How often he had winced at her patronage of strangers!
sentences.cn: 她那种对陌生人的沽恩庇护使他多少次从心坎里发冷 啊 !

sentences.en: I am sorry to say that my patronage ends with this.
sentences.cn: 很抱歉,我的赞助只能到此为止.

sentences.en: Patronage of the arts comes from businesses and private individuals.
sentences.cn: 对艺术的资助来自企业和个人。

sentences.en: Quietly but surely he retired Hanna as chief dispenser of patronage.
sentences.cn: 他不声不响但稳扎稳打地不让汉纳再作首席政治施惠人.

sentences.en: Solicit a continuance of customer's patronage.
The restaurant has a large patronage.
sentences.cn: 光顾这家餐馆的人很多.

sentences.en: The Vevey Festival was founded 12 years ago under the patronage of Oona Chaplin.
sentences.cn: 沃韦喜剧电影节是12年前在乌娜·卓别麟的赞助下设立的。

sentences.en: Those that live by patronage shall surely perish by patronage.
sentences.cn: 那些靠恩赐而生存的人,必然会由于接受恩赐而垮台.

sentences.en: We give our patronage to local shops.

trans.tran_cn: 资助，赞助，光顾，惠顾，任免权，支援，保护
trans.tran_en: the support, especially financial support, that is given to an organization or activity by a patron
